Compute
\[(-\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5} + \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{7})^2 + (\sqrt{3} - \sqrt{5} + \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{7})^2 + (\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5} - \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{7})^2 + (\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5} + \sqrt{6} - \sqrt{7})^2.\]
inference:
We can expand each of the squares and combine like terms.  The terms involving $\sqrt{3} \sqrt{5},$ $\sqrt{3} \sqrt{6},$ $\sqrt{3} \sqrt{7},$ $\sqrt{5} \sqrt{6},$ $\sqrt{5} \sqrt{7},$ and $\sqrt{6} \sqrt{7}$ all cancel out, leaving
\[4(3 + 5 + 6 + 7) = \boxed{84}.\]Final Answer: $\boxed{84}$. I hope it is correct.
